meanings.definition: A person who initiates or provokes a conflict or action.
meanings.sent1: The instigators of the argument were finally identified.
meanings.sent2: The police were able to catch the instigators of the protest.
meanings.sent3: The instigators of the food fight were caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as instigators, sparking a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The instigators of change are often met with resistance.

meanings.definition: Something that causes a particular event or situation to happen or exist.
meanings.sent1: The small mistake was the instigator of the big problem.
meanings.sent2: The lack of communication was the instigator of the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The missing ingredient turned out to be the instigator of the failed recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the instigator of his sudden happiness.
meanings.sent5: The instigator of success is often hard work.
